abstract: Nvidia, a chip maker in Silicon Valley, is using an interactive visualization software that makes it easier than ever for architects to work with their ideas in three dimensions.
lead_para: SANTA CLARA, Calif. — In the heart of Silicon Valley, you can slip on a virtual reality headset and fly through a photo-realistic three-dimensional building that will soon be the new corporate home for the chip maker Nvidia.
headline: Using Virtual Reality to Create a New Corporate Headquarters

abstract: Some say autonomous vehicles should have common technology before they hit the road, but there is also a strong case for independent approaches.
lead_para: The PC revolution, the internet boom, the smartphone economy — all were propelled along by a common set of technological standards. So will a standard platform or operating system be necessary to get autonomous cars rolling, too?
headline: Self-Driving Cars Might Need Standards, but Whose?

abstract: The chip giant gains new prominence in the race to make autonomous vehicles part of everyday life.
lead_para: About three years ago, the chip giant Intel seemed like a bystander in Silicon Valley’s race to develop self-driving cars.
headline: Driverless-Car Outlook Shifts as Intel Takes Over Mobileye

abstract: Nvidia, a maker of graphics processing units, is riding an artificial intelligence boom to put its chips in drones, robots and self-driving cars.
lead_para: SANTA CLARA, Calif. — Engineers at CTA.ai, an imaging-technology start-up in Poland, are trying to popularize a more comfortable alternative to the colonoscopy. To do so, they are using computer chips that are best known to video game fans.
headline: Why a 24-Year-Old Chipmaker Is One of Tech’s Hot Prospects

abstract: New technologies are testing the limits of computer semiconductors. To deal with that, researchers have gone looking for ideas from nature.
lead_para: SAN FRANCISCO — We expect a lot from our computers these days. They should talk to us, recognize everything from faces to flowers, and maybe soon do the driving. All this artificial intelligence requires an enormous amount of computing power, stretching the limits of even the most modern machines.
headline: Chips Off the Old Block: Computers Are Taking Design Cues From Human Brains

abstract: If the Trump administration pursues ways to curtail the company, it would meet sizable obstacles.
lead_para: Good Thursday. Here’s what we’re watching:
headline: Why Reining in Amazon Could be Difficult: DealBook Briefing

abstract: A microprocessor once found mostly in machines used for computer games turns out to have a role in both artificial intelligence systems and the mining of digital currencies.
lead_para: SAN FRANCISCO — Two technology booms — some people might call them frenzies — are combining to turn a once-obscure type of microprocessor into a must-have but scarce commodity.
headline: Why A.I. and Cryptocurrency Are Making One Type of Computer Chip Scarce

abstract: Forty-five young companies are building processors just for artificial intelligence. At least five have raised more than $100 million from investors.
lead_para: SAN FRANCISCO — For years, tech industry financiers showed little interest in start-up companies that made computer chips.
headline: Big Bets on A.I. Open a New Frontier for Chip Start-Ups, Too

abstract: Researchers in Finland have developed artificial intelligence that can generate images of celebrity look-alikes — and another system that tests how believable they are.
lead_para: Researchers in Finland have developed artificial intelligence that can generate images of celebrity look-alikes — and another system that tests how believable they are.
headline: How an A.I. ‘Cat-and-Mouse Game’ Generates Believable Fake Photos

abstract: Investors have returned to the safety and growth of the biggest technology stocks.
lead_para: Investors have returned to the safety and growth of the biggest technology stocks.
headline: Tech Stocks Are Hitting Highs as Economic Uncertainty Rises

abstract: As new fields demanded huge computing power, top chip manufacturers seemed invulnerable. Now shrinking sales suggest they’re still highly vulnerable.
lead_para: Get the DealBook newsletter to make sense of major business and policy headlines — and the power-brokers who shape them.__________
headline: The Chip Industry Can’t Seem to Escape Its Boom-and-Bust Past

abstract: From Apple to Nvidia, tech companies say business is slowing. Among the reasons: China and a Bitcoin slump. It may be just a bump — until it’s not.
lead_para: SAN FRANCISCO — Don’t look now: Storm clouds are gathering over tech.
headline: Behind Tech’s Shine, Some Warnings Signs Appear

abstract: Artificial intelligence has bested top players in chess, Go and even StarCraft. But can it fly a drone faster than a pro racer? More than $1 million is on the line to find out.
lead_para: A drone from the University of Zurich is an engineering and technical marvel. It also moves slower than someone taking a Sunday morning jog.
headline: A.I. Is Flying Drones (Very, Very Slowly)

abstract: Shares of Qualcomm, Nvidia and other American chip makers have tumbled as the companies find themselves at the center of the dispute between the U.S. and China.
lead_para: Get the DealBook newsletter to make sense of major business and policy headlines — and the power-brokers who shape them.__________
headline: Chip Makers Are Punished as the Trade War Drags On

abstract: China is heavily reliant on imported computer chips, despite efforts to develop its own semiconductor industry.
lead_para: BEIJING — For all of China’s efforts to become a global force in high technology rivaling the United States, it has mostly failed to produce top-flight contenders in one crucial area: the industry that gave Silicon Valley its name.
headline: Huawei’s U.S. Restrictions Expose a High-Tech Achilles’ Heel for China

abstract: The companies operate in very different sectors of China’s economy. But their message was nearly the same: business there is slowing.
lead_para: Corporate warnings about China’s sluggish economy hit stocks on Monday as the battle between the world’s largest economies over trade and technology continued to weigh on the outlook for growth and profits.
headline: China Warnings From Caterpillar and Nvidia Hit U.S. Stocks

abstract: The move gives Nvidia a way into mobile chips, but the acquisition is likely to face regulatory scrutiny.
lead_para: SAN FRANCISCO — Nvidia said on Sunday that it would acquire the British chip designer Arm from SoftBank in deal worth about $40 billion, a move that could reshape the battle over technology that powers smartphones and data centers.
headline: Nvidia Buys Arm From SoftBank for $40 Billion

abstract: They have two weeks to decide whether to accept government rescue loans, or try to weather the storm without them.
lead_para: Amid all the other news and analysis in today’s edition, we have the inside scoop on how SoftBank’s $40 billion deal to sell the British chip designer Arm came together — check it out below.
headline: Can Airlines Avoid Another Bailout?

abstract: A sale to Nvidia for more than $40 billion would net billions of dollars for the Japanese tech investor and create a powerhouse in the semiconductor industry.
lead_para: SoftBank is near a deal to sell the British chip designer Arm to Nvidia, two people briefed on the matter said on Saturday, which would raise billions for the Japanese technology investor and create a powerhouse in the semiconductor industry.
headline: SoftBank Said to Be Near Deal to Sell British Chip Designer Arm

abstract: Intel and Nvidia chips power a supercomputing center that tracks people in a place where government suppresses minorities, raising questions about the tech industry’s responsibility.
lead_para: URUMQI, China — At the end of a desolate road rimmed by prisons, deep within a complex bristling with cameras, American technology is powering one of the most invasive parts of China’s surveillance state.
headline: China’s Surveillance State Sucks Up Data. U.S. Tech Is Key to Sorting It.

abstract: The proposed deal would give Nvidia control over computing technology and designs that rival firms rely on.
lead_para: WASHINGTON — The Federal Trade Commission on Thursday sued to block Nvidia’s $40 billion acquisition of a fellow chip company, Arm, halting what would be the biggest semiconductor industry deal in history, as federal regulators push to rein in corporate consolidation.
headline: F.T.C. Sues to Stop Blockbuster Chip Deal Between Nvidia and Arm

abstract: This is what supply chain fragility looks like.
lead_para: As the fallout from Covid wreaks havoc on supply chains, a major economic and geopolitical tug of war has broken out.
headline: Your Car, Toaster, Even Washing Machine, Can’t Work Without Them. And There’s a Global Shortage.

abstract: The new coalition comes amid a global semiconductor shortage that has caused disruptions throughout the economy.
lead_para: Semiconductor companies and big businesses that use chips have formed a coalition to push for tens of billions of dollars in federal funding for semiconductor research and manufacturing in the United States.
headline: Semiconductor makers and users form a group to push for chip funding.

abstract: Facebook, Microsoft and Amazon are ramping up offerings on a platform that lets people enjoy high-quality games on any device.
lead_para: Imagine video gamers, untethered from their computers and consoles, playing crystal-clear versions of their favorite games anywhere. They might traverse the futuristic world of the sci-fi shooter game Halo on their mobile phones while riding the subway, or dust off old MacBook computers and hop straight into the jungle of the battle arena game League of Legends.
headline: ‘Crucial Time’ for Cloud Gaming, Which Wants to Change How You Play

abstract: Plunging profit, wobbly shares and a key executive’s departure after a bitter pay dispute beget the question: Will SoftBank rein in its freewheeling ways?
lead_para: For the past decade, SoftBank and its founder, Masayoshi Son, grabbed headlines mainly for the Japanese conglomerate’s eye-popping investments, becoming a fixture in the American technology scene by spending freely on start-ups and fundamentally reshaping how such companies had been funded.
headline: SoftBank’s Woes Are Mounting

abstract: The Japanese conglomerate said it would take the chip designer Arm public after an anticipated sale to Nvidia fell through.
lead_para: TOKYO — SoftBank announced on Tuesday that it had edged back into profitability, while also confirming that it will seek to take public one of its prize holdings, the chip designer Arm, after the collapse of a hoped-for sale to Nvidia, the Silicon Valley semiconductor manufacturer.
headline: SoftBank returns to profitability, barely, as the tech sector suffers.

abstract: The deal, which was initially valued at $40 billion, encountered regulatory scrutiny, including an F.T.C. lawsuit.
lead_para: SAN FRANCISCO — Nvidia, the Silicon Valley chip maker, has ended its nearly 18-month effort to buy Arm, which licenses chip technology used in most smartphones.
headline: Nvidia Deal to Buy Arm From SoftBank Is Off After Setbacks

abstract: Limits were placed on high-end GPUs that power supercomputers and artificial intelligence, said Nvidia and AMD, two Silicon Valley chip makers.
lead_para: The Biden administration has imposed new restrictions on sales of some sophisticated computer chips to China and Russia, the U.S. government’s latest attempt to use semiconductors as a tool to hobble rivals’ advances in fields such as high-performance computing and artificial intelligence.
headline: U.S. Restricts Sales of Sophisticated Chips to China and Russia

abstract: Demand for semiconductors was off the charts last year. But a sharp slowdown coupled with new U.S. restrictions against China have created obstacles.
lead_para: A few months ago, makers of computer chips seemed on top of the world.
headline: Chip Makers, Once in High Demand, Confront Sudden Challenges

abstract: The new rules could be the most sweeping action taken yet by the Biden administration to thwart China’s access to American technology that powers data centers and supercomputers.
lead_para: The Biden administration is expected to announce new measures to restrict Chinese companies from getting access to technologies that enable high-performance computing, according to several people familiar with the matter, the latest in a series of moves aimed at hobbling Beijing’s ambitions to craft next-generation weapons and automate large-scale surveillance systems.
headline: U.S. Said to Plan New Limits on China’s A.I. and Supercomputing Firms

abstract: The leaders of Google, OpenAI, Microsoft and others are meeting with lawmakers on Sept. 13 to kick off listening sessions that may shape A.I. rules in the United States.
lead_para: Senator Chuck Schumer, Democrat of New York, plans to kick off a series of listening sessions next month on the regulation of artificial intelligence with Elon Musk of Tesla, Sundar Pichai of Google, Sam Altman of OpenAI and Satya Nadella of Microsoft.
headline: Tech Chiefs to Gather in Washington Next Month on A.I. Regulations

abstract: As the tech giants found their financial footing last quarter, they doubled down on artificial intelligence, which has been a boon to companies like Nvidia.
lead_para: A year ago, the tech industry’s prospects looked bleak. Google’s profit dropped. Shares of Facebook’s parent company, Meta, were in free fall. Business growth at Amazon had slowed to its lowest level in two decades.
headline: Big Tech Rebounds and Preps for Transformative A.I. Investments

abstract: At 92, Morris Chang, the founder of Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company, can no longer stay in the shadows.
lead_para: In a wood-paneled office overlooking Taipei and the jungle-covered mountains that surround the Taiwanese capital, Morris Chang recently pulled out an old book stamped with technicolor patterns.
headline: The Chip Titan Whose Life’s Work Is at the Center of a Tech Cold War

abstract: To power artificial-intelligence products, start-ups and investors are taking extraordinary measures to obtain critical chips known as graphics processing units, or GPUs.
lead_para: For the past year, Jean Paoli, chief executive of the artificial intelligence start-up Docugami, has been scrounging for what has become the hottest commodity in tech: computer chips.
headline: The Desperate Hunt for the A.I. Boom’s Most Indispensable Prize

abstract: Apple, Nvidia, Tesla and Microsoft are among the giants that have tumbled by at least 10 percent in the past month after powering a market rally earlier this year.
lead_para: In the span of a month, the bottom has dropped out of the bull-market rally as investors have come to grips with the prospect of “higher for longer” interest rates worldwide. The sell-off in global stocks and bonds picked up steam on Thursday. And weary market watchers will be looking for more hints on the Fed’s view at next week’s Jackson Hole summit of central bankers and policymakers.
headline: Interest Rate Jitters Sink the Heavyweights of Tech

abstract: The I.P.O. filing means Arm can begin to gauge investor interest, which will be critical to the share sale.
lead_para: Arm, the chip design company owned by SoftBank, filed for an initial public offering on the Nasdaq exchange on Monday, in what is expected to be one of the largest I.P.O.s in recent years.
headline: Arm, the Chip Designer, Files for an I.P.O. Expected to Be Among the Largest

abstract: Sales for the current quarter will nearly triple their total a year ago, said the company, which makes chips essential to the development of A.I. systems.
lead_para: In a sign that the tech industry’s next big boom is picking up steam, Nvidia on Wednesday predicted rapid growth in the already rabid demand for the chips it makes to build artificial intelligence systems.
headline: Nvidia Revenue Doubles on Demand for A.I. Chips, and Could Go Higher

abstract: The most visible winner of the artificial intelligence boom achieved its dominance by becoming a one-stop shop for A.I. development, from chips to software to other services.
lead_para: Naveen Rao, a neuroscientist turned tech entrepreneur, once tried to compete with Nvidia, the world’s leading maker of chips tailored for artificial intelligence.
headline: How Nvidia Built a Competitive Moat Around A.I. Chips

abstract: Company leaders use the word “moat” a lot. That can sometimes invite regulatory scrutiny, as it did with Amazon, which was sued this week.
lead_para: Nvidia has been hailed by Wall Street for the “moat” it has built around its chips to power artificial intelligence systems. Starbucks wants to retain its moat in China.
headline: What C.E.O.s Mean When They Talk About ‘Moats’

abstract: The S&P 500 is trading at a three-month low as surging oil prices, rising bond yields and concerns about economic growth send investors to the exits.
lead_para: Stocks are heading for their worst month of the year as a triple whammy of soaring bond yields, rising oil prices and slowing growth trigger a widespread sell-off, even in once-loved mega-cap tech companies.
headline: What’s Driving the September Stock Swoon

abstract: The chip designer will begin trading on Thursday, in the biggest listing of the year. Investors hope it will rejuvenate demand for new stock offerings.
lead_para: All eyes are on Arm Thursday as the chip designer prepares to begin trading on the Nasdaq in the biggest initial public offering of the year. The company priced its shares on Wendesday at $51 each, the top end of its range, valuing it at about $54.5 billion.
headline: Arm’s I.P.O. Delivers a Big Test for the Markets

abstract: The effort by Senators Richard Blumenthal and Josh Hawley is the latest move by lawmakers to catch up with the rapidly evolving technology.
lead_para: Senator Richard Blumenthal, Democrat of Connecticut, and Senator Josh Hawley, Republican of Missouri, plan to announce a sweeping framework to regulate artificial intelligence, in the latest effort by Congress to catch up with the technology.
headline: 2 Senators Propose Bipartisan Framework for A.I. Laws

abstract: Investors await Friday’s inflation report for clues on what the Fed will do next on rates. But it is not the only data point Wall Street is watching.
lead_para: The final big test of the year for investors is set to arrive on Friday with the release at 8:30 a.m. Eastern of the Personal Consumption Expenditures report, the Fed’s preferred inflation gauge.
headline: The Eye-Popping Numbers Driving the Markets

abstract: If 2023 was the year of A.I. awakening, 2024 could be the year of A.I. reckoning.
lead_para: Mustafa Suleyman remembers the epochal moment he grasped artificial intelligence’s potential. It was 2016 — Paleolithic times by A.I. standards — and DeepMind, the company he had co-founded that was acquired by Google in 2014, had pitted its A.I. machine, AlphaGo, against a world champion of Go, the confoundingly difficult strategy game. AlphaGo zipped through thousands of permutations, making fast work of the hapless human. Stunned, Suleyman realized the machine had “seemingly superhuman insights,” he says in his  book on A.I., “The Coming Wave.”
headline: What’s Next in Artificial Intelligence?

abstract: What is a menopause-friendly workplace? Women in cities like New York may soon find out, as U.S. companies adopt practices that were already spreading in Britain.
lead_para: In the last few years, managers at Nvidia, the global computer graphics company, began hearing a new kind of complaint: Some of their female employees were struggling with hot flashes, fatigue and brain fog — common symptoms of the menopause transition — and their regular doctors weren’t offering guidance or relief.
headline: A Movement to Make Workplaces ‘Menopause Friendly’

abstract: A stock sell-off driven by a since-debunked picture underscored fears about how artificial intelligence could be used for nefarious purposes with big consequences.
lead_para: For a few minutes on Monday, an ominous image of black smoke billowing from what appeared to be a government building near the Pentagon set off investor fears, sending stocks tumbling.
headline: An A.I.-Generated Spoof Rattles the Markets

abstract: Shareholders are set to vote on Thursday whether to back the gene-sequencing company’s incumbent board or candidates named by the activist investor.
lead_para: One of the biggest fights in corporate America is coming to a head on Thursday: Shareholders in Illumina, the gene-sequencing giant, are set to vote on whether to back the company’s incumbent directors or candidates nominated by the billionaire Carl Icahn.
headline: Carl Icahn’s Battle with Illumina Comes to a Head

abstract: The Florida governor’s plan to announce his presidential campaign on the social network is the latest sign of the company’s efforts to court conservatives.
lead_para: Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida is expected to finally announce his presidential campaign on Wednesday night — but not on a stalwart of conservative media, like Fox News. Instead, the Republican star will do so live on Twitter, in a conversation with Elon Musk. (Fox News will get the first television interview with Mr. DeSantis afterward.)
headline: DeSantis’s Big Event Underscores a Rightward Move for Twitter

abstract: A ‘shock pause’ by the central bank would spook an already jittery market, one analyst said, even as shares in regional lenders fall.
lead_para: If market predictions are correct, the Fed on Wednesday will raise borrowing costs by a quarter of a percentage point, even as growing turmoil in the stocks of regional banks threatens to choke off credit to businesses and consumers, pushing the economy into recession.
headline: Markets Expect the Fed to Raise Rates Despite Banking Turmoil

abstract: Climate-focused shareholder activists have scored only a few victories in their efforts to push oil giants to adopt cleaner business strategies.
lead_para: The annual shareholder meetings of Exxon Mobil and Chevron, scheduled for Wednesday, are set to be largely sedate, as they will be held virtually. But their European rivals had raucous meetings last week, with environmental protesters storming the stage at Shell’s gathering and clashing with tear-gas-wielding police outside Total’s.
headline: Following Setbacks, Climate Activists Rethink Their Approach

abstract: The company delivered a robust sales forecast, powered by demand for the processors that run artificial intelligence systems.
lead_para: Shares in the chip maker Nvidia soared more than 24 percent on Thursday, after the company delivered a knockout quarterly sales outlook powered by demand for the processors that run artificial intelligence systems.
headline: A.I. Demand Lifts Nvidia Toward Trillion-Dollar Valuation

abstract: As investors press the oil giant on climate issues, activists say that a hedge fund’s eco-focused victory over the company two years ago has achieved little.
lead_para: At Exxon Mobil’s annual shareholder meeting on Wednesday, activist investors and big shareholders, including Legal & General Investment Management, will take on the company with a series of proxy measures aiming to push it to cut emissions and speed its decarbonization efforts.
headline: Reassessing the Board Fight That Was Meant to Transform Exxon

abstract: “It’s like if you were told that there’s going to be a world-conquering dictator and it’s Mr. Bean.”
lead_para: A few days after a lawyer used ChatGPT to write a brief filled with made-up cases, a group of A.I. experts released a letter warning of the “risk of extinction” from the technology. But will A.I. ever be good enough to pose such a threat?
headline: A.I.’s Inner Conflict, Nvidia Joins the Trillion-Dollar Club, and Hard Questions

abstract: Reports that the White House may clamp down on sales of semiconductors that power artificial intelligence capabilities sent tech stocks diving.
lead_para: The Biden administration is weighing additional curbs on China’s ability to access critical technology, including restricting the sale of high-end chips used to power artificial intelligence, according to five people familiar with the deliberations.
headline: Biden Administration Weighs Further Curbs on Sales of A.I. Chips to China

abstract: Global markets edged higher as the prospect of the United States defaulting on its debt grows more remote.
lead_para: The debt-ceiling deal is a step closer to becoming law after its breezy passage in the House last night, making the prospect of a U.S. default all the more remote. Investors expressed relief, sending global markets and U.S. stock futures higher this morning.
headline: Investors Exhale as Debt Limit Deal Clears a Big Hurdle

abstract: Jensen Huang, the C.E.O. of Nvidia, is transforming a black leather jacket into a symbol of the A.I. paradigm shift.
lead_para: There’s a new tech titan in town and he’s preparing to enter the pantheon. How do we know?
headline: Is This a Trillion-Dollar Look?

abstract: Shares in the semiconductor giants Nvidia and AMD fell on a report that the Biden Administration is weighing new restrictions on A.I.-related exports.
lead_para: Shares in high-flying chipmakers like Nvidia and AMD were down in premarket trading today, after The Wall Street Journal reported that the Biden administration is weighing new restrictions on exporting artificial intelligence-related semiconductors to China.
headline: The A.I. Chips War Could Heat Up This Summer

abstract: Foreign investors betting on artificial intelligence are pouring money into the company’s shares. Analysts say it will have a hard time keeping up with rivals.
lead_para: The introduction of ChatGPT has lit a fire under the shares of companies that produce microchips, the brains of artificial intelligence. Bets on the potential of so-called generative A.I. have poured in. The most eye-catching example of the rally is Silicon Valley’s Nvidia, the top seller of chips used in artificial intelligence, whose shares are up nearly 200 percent this year.
headline: Samsung’s A.I. Moment Is Here, but Is It Ready?

abstract: Demand for the company’s A.I. chips remains high, but it said new U.S. export restrictions would hurt it sales to countries like China.
lead_para: A start-up driving the artificial intelligence revolution may be in turmoil, but the semiconductor supplier propelling its innovations seems to be getting only stronger.
headline: Nvidia Triples Quarterly Revenue, but Sales in China Are a Concern

abstract: Vice President Kamala Harris, Elon Musk, Bob Iger, Jamie Dimon and Tsai Ing-wen, the president of Taiwan, are among the big names speaking.
lead_para: On Wednesday, DealBook will be live and in person at our annual summit in New York.
headline: What to Expect at Today’s DealBook Summit

abstract: Jensen Huang said that the chips giant enjoys a decadelong lead over rivals because it didn’t just make chips. It reinvented computers.
lead_para: In the year since OpenAI sparked an artificial intelligence boom with its popular ChatGPT chatbot, start-ups and tech giants have been scrambling to develop semiconductors to power the buzzy technology, hoping to muscle in on Nvidia’s market dominance.
headline: Nvidia C.E.O. Is Not Worried About Rising A.I. Industry Competition

abstract: Jensen Huang, the chief executive of Nvidia, said that he believed the United States was at least a decade away from breaking its dependence on chips created overseas.
lead_para: Jensen Huang, the chief executive of Nvidia, said that he believed the United States was at least a decade away from breaking its dependence on chips created overseas.
headline: U.S. Will Take Years to Reach Chip Independence, Nvidia C.E.O. Says

abstract: Nvidia, Intel and Qualcomm are campaigning to protect their businesses before further crackdowns on the sale of semiconductor technology to Beijing.
lead_para: A year after the Biden administration took its first major step toward restricting the sale of semiconductors to China, it has begun drafting additional limits aimed at denying Beijing the technology critical to modern-day weapons.
headline: How the Big Chip Makers Are Pushing Back on Biden’s China Agenda

abstract: Behind the scenes, the technology relies on thousands of specialized computer chips.
lead_para: OpenAI’s ChatGPT exploded onto the scene nearly a year ago, reaching an estimated 100 million users in two months and setting off an A.I. boom. Behind the scenes, the technology relies on thousands of specialized computer chips. And in the coming years, they couldconsume immense amounts of electricity.
headline: A.I. Could Soon Need as Much Electricity as an Entire Country

abstract: The further limits on shipments could cripple Beijing’s A.I. ambitions and dampen revenues for U.S. chip makers, analysts said.
lead_para: The Biden administration on Tuesday announced additional limits on sales of advanced semiconductors by American firms, shoring up restrictions issued last October to limit China’s progress on supercomputing and artificial intelligence.
headline: U.S. Tightens China’s Access to Advanced Chips for Artificial Intelligence

abstract: Researchers are transforming chatbots into online agents that play games, query websites, schedule meetings, build bar charts and do more.
lead_para: The widely used chatbot ChatGPT was designed to generate digital text, everything from poetry to term papers to computer programs. But when a team of artificial intelligence researchers at the computer chip company Nvidia got their hands on the chatbot’s underlying technology, they realized it could do a lot more.
headline: How ‘A.I. Agents’ That Roam the Internet Could One Day Replace Workers

abstract: The conference on Nov. 29 will bring together the biggest newsmakers in business, politics and culture.
lead_para: We’re excited to announce the lineup for the DealBook Summit, to be held at Jazz at Lincoln Center in New York City on Nov. 29. Andrew will host a series of conversations with the biggest newsmakers in the worlds of business, politics and culture. We hope you will join us.
headline: Elon Musk, Kamala Harris, Jamie Dimon Will Speak at the DealBook Summit

abstract: The chipmaker’s high “price to sales” ratio reflects investor enthusiasm around its growth prospects. But relying on that metric created trouble during the dot-com boom.
lead_para: In 2002, after the dot-com bubble burst and Sun Microsystems swooned, the company’s co-founder Scott McNealy highlighted the folly of Wall Street analysts who favored one particular financial metric to gauge a stock’s worth: its price relative to the company’s sales.
headline: Nvidia Is a Must-Buy. Or Is It?

abstract: The A.I. chip maker’s revenue more than tripled, and profits rose ninefold. It also projected that its revenue would more than triple again.
lead_para: Nvidia, the kingpin of chips powering artificial intelligence, on Wednesday released quarterly financial results that reinforced how the company has become one of the biggest winners of the artificial intelligence boom, and it said demand for its products would fuel continued sales growth.
headline: Nvidia Says Growth Will Continue as A.I. Hits ‘Tipping Point’

abstract: Amid blowout earnings, the chipmaker Nvidia predicted the start of a “10-year cycle” of growth fueled by artificial intelligence.
lead_para: For now, Nvidia is living up to the lofty title that Goldman Sachs bestowed on it this week — “the most important stock on planet Earth” — after its blowout earnings report.
headline: An A.I. ‘Tipping Point’ Ignites a New Market Rally

abstract: Wall Street is closely watching the semiconductor giant’s earnings report, as questions swirl over its massive stock market valuation on the back of the boom in artificial intelligence.
lead_para: The stock price of the chip giant Nvidia has marched steadily higher over the past year and a half, propelled by investors’ hopes that artificial intelligence is truly transformative technology — and by their hope that the company’s high-end semiconductors will continue to power that technology.
headline: The Chips Riding on Nvidia

abstract: It was the S&P 500’s best day in more than a year, and the tech-heavy Nasdaq composite rose 3 percent.
lead_para: Stocks on Wall Street recorded their biggest gain in more than a year on Thursday, a day after Nvidia, which has become an emblem of the growth potential offered by artificial intelligence, reported record profits.
headline: Stocks Jump as Nvidia Sets Off Tech Rally

abstract: The market value of Nvidia, the chipmaker powering artificial intelligence, has surged by more than $1.4 trillion over the last 12 months.
lead_para: The market value of Nvidia, the chipmaker powering artificial intelligence, has surged by more than $1.4 trillion over the last 12 months.
headline: The Big Number: $1.4 Trillion

abstract: A.I. fervor has rocketed the chip company’s share price upward. Our columnist asked A.I. chatbots how big Nvidia would become if it kept growing as fast as it had over the past year.
lead_para: It’s not a household name quite yet, but anyone who follows the stock market knows at least a little about Nvidia.
headline: If Nvidia Keeps Rising Like This, It Will Be Bigger Than the Global Economy

abstract: The chipmaker unveiled a new high-speed processor at its developer conference to power an “industrial revolution,” but its sky-high valuation is coming under scrutiny.
lead_para: Nvidia’s stock has soared more than fivefold since ChatGPT debuted in November 2022, a rally that has vaulted the chipmaker into the trillion-dollar market cap club on the back of investor fervor for artificial intelligence — and the high-end processors that power these models.
headline: Investors Shrug Off Nvidia’s ‘A.I. Woodstock’

abstract: U.S. and European companies looking to diversify from China are expanding around Southeast Asia, a sign of how geopolitics is reshaping tech manufacturing.
lead_para: Construction cranes still surround the brand-spanking new plant in Kulim’s industrial park in Malaysia. But inside, legions of workers hired by the Austrian tech giant AT&S are already gearing up to produce at full capacity by year’s end.
headline: Malaysia Rises as Crucial Link in Chip Supply Chain

abstract: Are role-playing games enriching culture, or destroying it? In two shows, the artist Simon Denny spoofs the grandiose fantasy worlds of tech entrepreneurs designing virtual reality.
lead_para: The capricious churn of internet-charged culture is producing more main characters, apocrypha and relics than we can handle. Remember when the Canadian musician known as Grimes — former partner of one of the world’s most powerful men, the tech entrepreneur Elon Musk — brought a sword to the 2021 Met Gala? The image of a futurist pop star lugging a medieval blade (made from a smelted AR-15, no less) down the red carpet summed up the mystifying way contemporary culture seems to run in all directions, chasing myths both new and old.
headline: Off the Board Game, Onto the Digital Canvas

abstract: The U.S. is trying to stop China from getting Nvidia microchips to advance its military. The private sector is fighting back.
lead_para: In the southern Chinese city of Shenzhen, a mazelike market stretches for a half-mile, packed with stalls selling every type of electronic imaginable.
headline: With Smugglers and Front Companies, China Is Skirting American A.I. Bans

abstract: The Times found an active trade in Nvidia chips in China despite U.S. national security restrictions, as well as unreported incidents of how the technology had been used to further defense research.
lead_para: The United States has tried, with some success, to halt China’s progress with artificial intelligence amid concerns that the technology is helping modernize the Chinese military.
headline: Takeaways From Our Investigation Into Banned A.I. Chips in China

abstract: The A.I. chip maker’s shares fell in early trading, but the stock pared some of its losses.
lead_para: Nvidia shares tumbled more than 10 percent in early trading on Monday after reports that the company would delay shipments of its newest artificial intelligence chip, but the stock later rebounded as investors’ concerns about the costs of the delay faded.
headline: Nvidia Tumbles After Reports of Chip Delay

abstract: Led by the investment firm Thrive Capital, the new deal would value the artificial intelligence start-up at over $100 billion.
lead_para: Apple and the chipmaker Nvidia are in talks to invest in OpenAI as part of a new deal that would value the San Francisco artificial intelligence start-up at $100 billion, according to three people familiar with the discussions, who spoke on the condition of anonymity.
headline: Apple and Nvidia in Talks to Invest in OpenAI

abstract: With a 90 percent share of the A.I. chip market, the company is facing antitrust investigations into the possibility that it could lock in customers or hurt competitors.
lead_para: Nvidia rocketed to the top of the tech industry by providing the computer chips essential to building artificial intelligence. By the end of last year, it had more than a 90 percent share of those chips sold around the world.
headline: As Regulators Close In, Nvidia Scrambles for a Response

abstract: Expectations for the chipmaker have been through the roof because of its dominance in a key component for artificial intelligence systems.
lead_para: This summer, Wall Street and Silicon Valley began to question whether generative artificial intelligence could produce enough benefits to justify its staggering costs.
headline: Nvidia Revenue Jumps 122% in Positive Sign for Tech’s A.I. Boom

abstract: WeRide, a $5 billion software maker, is set for an I.P.O. amid geopolitical risks and a rush by Chinese automotive tech firms to raise money in the United States.
lead_para: One of China’s leading autonomous driving start-ups is set to go public in New York as soon as this week, with the strained relationship between Beijing and Washington lurking in the background.
headline: A Chinese Self-Driving Start-Up Is About to Go Public in the U.S.

abstract: Nvidia chips, which are crucial to artificial intelligence, are traded actively in China, despite U.S. restrictions, The Times found.
lead_para: The American company Nvidia has created one of the world’s most sought-after inventions: a computer chip that powers artificial intelligence.
headline: The Battle to Control the World’s Most Powerful Technology

abstract: Artificial intelligence’s hunger for energy has set off a boom in utility stocks and may lead to the reopening of the Three Mile Island nuclear plant, our columnist says.
lead_para: Want to make a wager on the future of artificial intelligence? Nvidia is the obvious bet. It designs the chips and software that make A.I. run, is the stock market favorite and has gained 144 percent this year alone.
headline: Nuclear Power Is the New A.I. Trade. What Could Possibly Go Wrong?

abstract: Sam Altman, OpenAI’s chief executive, is talking to the United Arab Emirates, Asian chipmakers and U.S. officials to expand the computing power needed to build artificial intelligence.
lead_para: Late last year, Sam Altman, the chief executive of OpenAI, started pitching an audacious plan that he hoped would create the computing power his company needed to build more powerful artificial intelligence.
headline: Behind OpenAI’s Audacious Plan to Make A.I. Flow Like Electricity

abstract: Efforts by the Beijing-backed Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corporation, or SMIC, to break through innovation barriers have landed it in a geopolitical tech battle.
lead_para: In a sprawling factory in eastern Shanghai, where marshy plains have long since been converted into industrial parks, China’s most advanced chipmaker has been hard at work testing the limits of U.S. authority.
headline: The Chinese Chipmaker at the Heart of the U.S.-China Tech War

abstract: Jim Covello, Goldman Sachs’s head of stock research, warned that building too much of what the world doesn’t need “typically ends badly.”
lead_para: As Jim Covello’s car barreled up Highway 101 from San Jose to San Francisco this month, he counted the billboards about artificial intelligence. The nearly 40 signs he passed, including one that promoted something called Writer Enterprise AI and another for Speech AI, were fresh evidence, he thought, of an economic bubble.
headline: Will A.I. Be a Bust? A Wall Street Skeptic Rings the Alarm.

abstract: Another day of anxiety hit stock markets around the world, with technology stocks the focus of attention.
lead_para: Markets remained unsettled on Wednesday as technology stocks continued to fall, dragging down stock indexes across the world for a second consecutive day.
headline: Wall Street Is Unsettled Again, After Fueling a Global Sell-Off

abstract: One of the hazards of buying individual stocks is that their current price may have little to do with their fundamental value, our columnist says.
lead_para: Nvidia designs most of the advanced chips that power artificial intelligence, and that has made it an earnings machine, producing astonishing profits that have buoyed the entire stock market.
headline: Nvidia Holds the Key to the Market. But Is It Worth This Much?

abstract: The Silicon Valley company would be among the first A.I. companies to go public since the release of ChatGPT nearly two years ago.
lead_para: For two years, stock investors wanting in on the frenzy around artificial intelligence have had only a few tech industry options: big companies like Microsoft and Nvidia. But that is set to change in the coming weeks with the market debut of Cerebras, a chip company with bold ambitions to take on Nvidia.
headline: Cerebras, an A.I. Chipmaker Trying to Take On Nvidia, Files for an I.P.O.

abstract: In an unsigned order, the justices dismissed the case against the tech giant as “improvidently granted,” meaning they had concluded that it had been a mistake to take it up.
lead_para: The Supreme Court, which heard arguments last month about whether to allow a lawsuit accusing Nvidia of misrepresenting its reliance on the cryptocurrency mining industry, announced on Wednesday that it would not decide the case after all.
headline: Supreme Court Won’t Decide Nvidia Securities Fraud Case After All

abstract: The chipmaker expects more than $10 billion in foreign sales this year, but the Biden administration is advancing rules that could curb that growth.
lead_para: In early August, the king of Bhutan, Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck, traveled from the mountains of his landlocked Asian country to the headquarters of Nvidia, a maker of artificial intelligence chips in the flatlands of Silicon Valley.
headline: Nvidia’s Booming A.I. Business Collides With U.S.-Chinese Tensions

abstract: Companies like OpenAI and Google are running out of the data used to train artificial intelligence systems. Can new methods continue years of rapid progress?
lead_para: Demis Hassabis, one of the most influential artificial intelligence experts in the world, has a warning for the rest of the tech industry: Don’t expect chatbots to continue to improve as quickly as they have over the last few years.
headline: Is the Tech Industry Already on the Cusp of an A.I. Slowdown?

abstract: Amazon, Advanced Micro Devices and several start-ups are beginning to offer credible alternatives to Nvidia’s chips, especially for a phase of A.I. development known as “inferencing.”
lead_para: On the south side of Austin, Texas, engineers at the semiconductor maker Advanced Micro Devices designed an artificial intelligence chip called MI300 that was released a year ago and is expected to generate more than $5 billion in sales in its first year of release.
headline: The Furious Contest to Unseat Nvidia as King of A.I. Chips

abstract: The move by Chinese regulators came a week after the Biden administration expanded curbs on the sale of advanced U.S. technology to China.
lead_para: China’s antimonopoly regulator announced on Monday that it was investigating potential violations of antitrust law by Nvidia, the American company that makes a vast majority of the computer chips that power artificial intelligence systems.
headline: China Opens Investigation Into Nvidia Over Potential Antitrust Violations

abstract: The chief executive of Nvidia, Jensen Huang, has taken advantage of popular loopholes in the federal estate and gift taxes, which have quietly been eviscerated.
lead_para: Jensen Huang, the chief executive of Nvidia, is the 10th-richest person in the United States, worth $127 billion. In theory, when he dies, his estate should pay 40 percent of his net worth to the government in taxes.
headline: How One of the World’s Richest Men Is Avoiding $8 Billion in Taxes

abstract: The Silicon Valley company was again lifted by sales of its artificial intelligence chips, but it faces growing competition and heightened expectations.
lead_para: Nvidia, which makes microchips that power most artificial intelligence applications, began an extraordinary run a year ago.
headline: Nvidia, Powered by A.I. Boom, Reports Soaring Revenue and Profits

abstract: The London-based developer of artificial intelligence systems for self-driving vehicles raised the funding from SoftBank, Nvidia, Microsoft and others.
lead_para: Wayve, a London maker of artificial intelligence systems for autonomous vehicles, said on Tuesday that it had raised $1 billion, an eye-popping sum for a European start-up and an illustration of investor optimism about A.I.’s ability to reshape industries.
headline: Wayve, an A.I. Start-Up for Autonomous Driving, Raises $1 Billion

abstract: Expectations are sky-high for the chipmaker’s latest earnings report. The company is at the center of Wall Street’s focus on artificial intelligence.
lead_para: Despite concerns about stubbornly high inflation, elevated interest rates and ballooning U.S. debt, the S&P 500 is trading at a record on Wednesday, having soared 27 percent over the past year.
headline: Testing the Nvidia Boom

abstract: The S&P 500 crossed above its January 2022 peak after weeks of wavering. Investors have been buying stocks after homing in on signals that the Fed’s campaign of raising interest rates is over.
lead_para: The stock market broke through to new heights on Friday, with the S&P 500 index finally hitting a record after weeks of bumping up against its previous peak.
headline: Stocks Climb to Record, Lifted by Big Tech and Rate Cut Hopes

abstract: Chafing at their dependence, Amazon, Google, Meta and Microsoft are racing to cut into Nvidia’s dominant share of the market.
lead_para: In September, Amazon said it would invest up to $4 billion in Anthropic, a San Francisco start-up working on artificial intelligence.
headline: Nvidia’s Big Tech Rivals Put Their Own A.I. Chips on the Table

abstract: See how a handful of stocks have had an outsize impact on the performance of the S&P 500
lead_para: See how a handful of stocks have had an outsize impact on the performance of the S&P 500
headline: These Seven Tech Stocks Are Driving the Market

abstract: Seven tech stocks, including Meta, Nvidia and Apple, have accounted for roughly 90 percent of the S&P’s gains over the past 12 months.
lead_para: Seven tech stocks, including Meta, Nvidia and Apple, have accounted for roughly 90 percent of the S&P’s gains over the past 12 months.
headline: The S&P 500 Through the Prism of a ‘Magnificent 7’

abstract: Plus, baseball legend Willie Mays dies at 93.
lead_para: On Today’s Episode:
headline: Netanyahu Lashes Out at U.S., and the Stock Market’s New King

abstract: The market value on Tuesday of Nvidia, whose chips have made it possible to create A.I. systems.
lead_para: It’s a number that kept going up, with few signs of slowing down.
headline: $3.34 Trillion

abstract: In high-tech labs, workers are generating data to train A.I. algorithms to design better medicine, faster. But the transformation is just getting underway.
lead_para: The laboratory at Terray Therapeutics is a symphony of miniaturized automation. Robots whir, shuttling tiny tubes of fluids to their stations. Scientists in blue coats, sterile gloves and protective glasses monitor the machines.
headline: How A.I. Is Revolutionizing Drug Development

abstract: The chipmaker’s stock has tumbled in recent days, a reminder that the artificial intelligence stock boom could be tough to sustain.
lead_para: It looks like another volatile day for Nvidia shareholders. And given the company’s enormous influence on the entire S&P 500, they may not be the only investors facing big swings.
headline: Inside Nvidia’s $500 Billion Wipeout

abstract: The Justice Department and the Federal Trade Commission agreed to divide responsibility for investigating three major players in the artificial intelligence industry.
lead_para: Federal regulators have reached a deal that allows them to proceed with antitrust investigations into the dominant roles that Microsoft, OpenAI and Nvidia play in the artificial intelligence industry, in the strongest sign of how regulatory scrutiny into the powerful technology has escalated.
headline: U.S. Clears Way for Antitrust Inquiries of Nvidia, Microsoft and OpenAI

abstract: The chip maker’s stock price has jumped over the last year thanks to its stranglehold on the market for the chips needed to build A.I. systems.
lead_para: Move over, Microsoft and Apple. The stock market has a new king.
headline: Nvidia Becomes Most Valuable Public Company, Topping Microsoft

abstract: Investors have high hopes for the chipmaker, the world’s most valuable company, which has enormous influence over the stock market.
lead_para: Nvidia is on a run for the ages, blowing past Wall Street’s earnings estimates for eight consecutive quarters. Investors are holding their breath to see whether the chipmaker at the heart of the artificial intelligence boom can do it again on Wednesday, when it is set to report its latest earnings.
headline: What to Know About Nvidia’s High-Stakes Earnings Report

abstract: It’s already powering remarkable visual innovations, like in the new movie “Here.” But boosters think that’s just the beginning.
lead_para: The Los Angeles headquarters of Metaphysic, a Hollywood visual-effects start-up that uses artificial intelligence to create digital renderings of the human face, were much cooler in my imagination, if I’m being honest. I came here to get my mind blown by A.I., and this dim three-room warren overlooking Sunset Boulevard felt more like the slouchy offices of a middling law firm. Ed Ulbrich, Metaphysic’s chief content officer, steered me into a room that looked set to host a deposition, then sat me down in a leather desk chair with a camera pointed at it. I stared at myself on a large flat-screen TV, waiting to be sworn in.
headline: What if A.I. Is Actually Good for Hollywood?

abstract: The case, which is in an early stage, accused the giant technology company of misleading investors about its exposure to the cryptocurrency industry.
lead_para: The Supreme Court seemed inclined on Wednesday to allow a lawsuit accusing Nvidia, the giant maker of computer chips, of misrepresenting its reliance on the cryptocurrency mining industry in 2017 and 2018.
headline: Supreme Court Seems Ready to Allow Securities Fraud Case Against Nvidia

abstract: The change, starting next Friday, lifts a dominant player in artificial intelligence over its chip-making rival, which has struggled to keep up.
lead_para: The chip-maker Nvidia will soon replace its rival Intel in the Dow Jones industrial average, S&P Dow Jones Indices said on Friday, reflecting Nvidia’s dominance in the world of artificial intelligence.
headline: Nvidia Will Replace Intel in the Dow Jones Stock Index

abstract: The company, which dominates the market for chips used to build artificial intelligence, expects another big jump in the current quarter.
lead_para: Nvidia, which dominates the market for computer chips used to build artificial intelligence, has become a Wall Street sensation.
headline: Nvidia Doubles Profit as A.I. Chip Sales Soar

abstract: A plan to revive U.S. chip manufacturing rests partly on a company that is firing workers and delaying factories, even as the government pushes for the opposite.
lead_para: At an annual gathering of tech executives and billionaires in Sun Valley, Idaho, this past July, Gina Raimondo commandeered a table near a duck pond and tried to exert her influence as the U.S. secretary of commerce to help rescue an ailing national champion.
headline: The White House Bet Big on Intel. Will It Backfire?

abstract: Intel was for decades Silicon Valley’s dominant chip company. But missed opportunities and poor execution left it on the sidelines in tech’s latest gold rush.
lead_para: In 2005, there was no inkling of the artificial intelligence boom that would come years later. But directors at Intel, whose chips served as electronic brains in most computers, faced a decision that might have altered how that transformative technology evolved.
headline: How Intel Got Left Behind in the A.I. Chip Boom
